info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 6:01PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Rutherford, northeastern Henderson, Polk, Cleveland, northwestern Gaston and northwestern Spartanburg Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 601 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southwest of Forest City, or 6 miles northwest of Chesnee, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shelby, Forest City, Rutherfordton, Columbus, Cherryville, Spindale, Boiling Springs NC, Landrum, Tryon and Belwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
